column2: Press “Win + E” keys, open File Explorer, go to the folder where “cmdextension.msi” locates
In file explorer, click on “File -> Open Windows PowerShell -> Open Windows PowerShell as administrator”
Wait 1 minute, and run command: msiexec /x cmdextension.msi /qn+
column3: The prompt window should pop up: Title is “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension”, and Message is “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension Setup completed successfully.”

column2: Open “Control Panel -> Programs -> Uninstall a program”
column3: Verify there is NO “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension” in the list of installed programs.

column2: Press “Win + R” keys, type “services.msc” and press Enter.
column3: Verify there is NO “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension”.

column2: Open filer explorer, go to "C:\\Program Files" (for 64bit version) or "C:\\Program Files (x86)" (for 32bit version)
column3:
Verify there is NO
“Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension” folder.
Verify “Service is on OnStop” is printed.

column2: Press “Win + R” keys, type “taskschd.msc” and press Enter. Open “Task scheduler library -> Microsoft -> CMD”
column3: Verify there is NOT “Cloud Managed Desktop Extension Health Evaluation”.

column2: Press “Win + R” keys, type “wbemtest” and press Enter. Click on “Connect”, type “root\cmd\clientagent” and press Enter.
column3: Verify there is error prompt window which displays “Invalid namespace”.
Verify there is no "CloudManagementDesktop" under Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft for x86, Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft for x64
